body_html:
The rearrange is only necessary to comply with a numpy image but it is no general requirement for the conversion to a tensor. You should be aware of how you expect the different color channels to end up in the tensor. OpenCV represents images as BGR bytes with stride = tensor(height, width, BGR) while numpy represents color images as (RGB, height, width). The final dimensions of (1,3,width, height) in the example code suggest that a conversion to a numpy image is intended.
…

body:
The rearrange is only necessary to comply with a numpy image but it is no
general requirement for the conversion to a tensor. You should be aware of
how you expect the different color channels to end up in the tensor. OpenCV
represents images as BGR bytes with stride = tensor(height, width, BGR) while
numpy represents color images as (RGB, height, width). The final dimensions
of (1,3,width, height) in the example code suggest that a conversion to a
numpy image is intended.

>
